column5: Awesome report Brian.. I'd love to get over to them whitie grounds  Thanks for sharing

WOW what a morning to head out and get out to fish some open water and the weather gods were right on the money this morning. Launched out from Oro. Nothing but glass.           Made for a nice ride over to the whitie grounds. I arrive and there are already a hand full of boats and everyone is catching.  I tye on my mini green monster and it didnt take long for the first fish to be on.Nice laker and he took it big time.                I marked fish from 30 fow all the way to the bottom.UNREAL. I always heard the action was hot off JP,but what I seen was so unreal. After about two and a half hours of busting chops,I headed down to cooks for some pike,n. The bite wasnt fast and furious as the morning but manged a few toothy critter.     Even had a X-Rap finally break on me,but Im sure after 50 or so hit on one lure,it would happen. That lure sure caught me alot of fish.     Good entertaining morning out.  Back at it again in the AM.  Hey Jiggy,Webster say hello. I looked for ya,but never found ya.  Who said ya cant catch whities and lakers from a bass boat.
Awesome!!
great pics thanks for the report
Great report Brian, looks a heck of alot better than spending more money at Bass Pro today  Good stuff, sorry about the lure.  Joey
How about the liters of petro I used looking for you guys. HAHAHAHAHAAHA  Oh Tybo went nuts again didnt he.LOL  What ye all buy today?????????????
Joey here,  You can afford the petrol can't ya     A big bass fisherman like yourself must be rolling in trophy dough  Bought another salmon rod, some flashers and a coupla lures, woohooo.  Joey
What a great day you had.  Awesome report man!
Wow!!! What a day!  Starting to like the whitie and laker fishing myself!  Amazing report and pics  lovetofish
Great stuff Brian, glad you had such a great day today...hope it's the same for everyone tomorrow.  Maureen
looks like a great day you did much better then I did today
WTG Brian, the fish don't know you are fishing out of a bass boat, and probably don't care.  Glad you had a good day out.
great report brian, i've got to get out there for ome of that whitie/laker action
Gotta like that action, WTG...
Holy Crap Brian,when I first saw,I thought you fell out of the boat again But you caught some nice fish bud.WTG  Steve
Great report Brian. Thanks
Great report!!! Beautiful scenery  Tinman
NICE MIXED BAG OF FISH BRO
....Ah, the green monster strikes again.
Excellant report. I am surprised you were marking fish as shallow as 30 feet! Every year I say I am going to go for crappies and white fish but never end up doing it.
Atta boy!
nice report, thanks for sharing!
Sorry I was in 65 fow,marked from 30 ft down JB.Even the herring were jumping around.Im guessing the lakers were chasing them around.

MMMMMMMmmmmmmmmmmmmmm Lake trout my favorite...... Nice fish.... Gettin a woodie lookin at the pics.... Gotta love the rod vibration with whitefish... Only freshwater that can shake a rod like it does.. lol... Awesome!
Great pic's Brian. You gave me an idea on the way up north tomorrow. Were would you launch on the west side for the Whites if you were heading north Brian. Thanks Farmer
